website_summaries.verdict: This deluxe DSLR camera case comes with 16 padded pockets.
pros: Equipped with spacious interior compartments that are simple to configure however you choose
Much larger than many comparable cases
Rugged construction ensures the case will maintain its appearance over time
cons: May be too short or too narrow for some DSLR cameras

customer_reviews.title: but not happy with the amount of room I was getting for ...
customer_reviews.text: I've moved from a smaller camera bag, to the back pack style, but not happy with the amount of room I was getting for the addition of my extra lenses, a back up camera, etc. This Ape Case fits it all! The bag is definitely larger and designed for a working photographer. There are so many little pockets and zippers for my accessories as well. This for a fraction of the price of some of the designer camera bags I'd been looking at. I think I can finally stop searching for the ultimate storage bag!! :)
customer_reviews.author: D CHRISTIE

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cases!
customer_reviews.text: I bought both the medium and large Ape cases and I love them. I am using the large for a Canon G50 video camera with rig, and not only can it easily fit the camera with cage & zoom H5, but it also fits a Blackmagic Video Assist, AC adapters, cables, etc. etc., and I still have plenty of unused pockets. My one criticism is that while they are very customizable with many dividers, they could do with more velcro on the inside case sides for the dividers to attach to. Otherwise they are really nicely made cases and I am quite happy with them. Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: ctx1050

customer_reviews.title: Good bag with room for large camcorder, boom mic, & accessories
customer_reviews.text: I'm really pleased with this bag. I'm using it to store my Panasonic AG-AC90 large HD camcorder. It fits the camcorder well with plenty of room to also store my Rode boom mic, batteries, chargers, and even my small handheld HD camcorder too. I don't use this to travel with or go out into rugged conditions with, but it works exactly as I'd hoped to store and move my equipment short distances. I haven't experienced any issues with stitching, zippers, handle problems, or strap issues. It's working great for what I need it to do. I would buy it again if it got lost or stolen and recommend it to a friend with similar needs.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this case. It is just the tiniest bit narrow with a laptop and 2 DSLRs but I like my gear snug so that works for me. I keep a D7200 w/battery grip and either no lens or a small prime like a 50mm and D750 with an 85mm 1.8, a 70-200 f2.8, a 24-120 f4 a 105mm f2.8 macro, a flash and a 15" laptop in it nearly all the time. It's heavy but I typically don't have far to carry it :). It's sturdy and well made and the shoulder strap works perfectly for my.
customer_reviews.author: Gwendlyn L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2 cameras
customer_reviews.text: I use this to store multiple cameras and lenses (2 cameras, 4+ lenses with accessories, multiple batteries) and it can keep everything securely packed with room to spare. The build quality is great and there are plenty of pouches for things of all sizes. My only gripe is that I would have loved to see a smaller zippable mesh compartment for easy access to memory cards. There is only one mesh zippable pouch and it is extremely large (the entire inner top) so it's a waste to use it just for memory cards.
customer_reviews.author: Jon S

customer_reviews.title: Big and bigger, better and best
customer_reviews.text: This is a big, strong, beautiful, capacious, pro-grade camera bag. I'm no pro as a photographer ... just an active amateur ... but I really enjoy great craftsmanship. I am confident that it will keep my cameras & gear safe from drops and bangs... just about anything short of an elephant stampede. In terms of quality & usefulness per dollar of its price tag, this is bag is a real bargain.
customer_reviews.author: W.P.T. Bellgamin

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera Bag
customer_reviews.text: Utilizing this bag for my video camera and extra accessories as well as spare batteries that I use for run-and-gun type projects. It perfectly fits everything, and has a sturdy padded carrying shoulder strap. Overall, I’m quite happy with the bag, I’m confident I’ll get many years out of this. I would certainly recommend this too photographers and even videographers.
customer_reviews.author: BStan511

customer_reviews.title: It fits my strobe, 15” MacBook Pro, Superzoom Lens, & Canon 5D Mark IV
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had two ape case backpacks for years now that was given to me by another photog and they’re used everyday just about without any signs of wear. So I had plenty of faith to make the jump for a bag that’s been on the market since 2003. It holds pretty much everything in a compact space that I’d need on a shoot. I highly recommend this bag! This bag is better and more sturdy than just about anything new on the market. Some of the new kids on the blocks should take note on how to design a camera bag.
customer_reviews.author: TheAmazonPrime

customer_reviews.title: Great For Small DSLR & Accessories
customer_reviews.text: Appears sturdy & well made. Spent an hour configuring dividers and sticking/unsticking Velcro fastening system for my camera & accessories. The Velcro is EXTREMELY strong - kinda like a fly in a spider web. While moving stuff around the Velcro would brush against inside of case and stick. Removing it caused the other side of divider to stick, etc. This is a GOOD thing once you get everything where you want it. It's not moving! Happy with Ape. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Thos

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot; great bag
customer_reviews.text: Great bag; large enough for a camera body with extended battery pack; three lenses, two strobes, and a lot of accessories. Convenient and durable. My only criticism is that the tie down cords on the outside pockets are not elastic (like bungee cords) and the clips to hold the cords taught don't work. I'll probably replace the cords myself with something more useful. That said, it's well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ron P

customer_reviews.title: Just right.
customer_reviews.text: Just like Goldilocks said, "This one is just right." Pros: Well constructed, easily configurable, large enough for DSLR, 2 lenses, flash batteried filters, etc. The strap is comfortable, handle is comfortable, yellow interior helps in finding equiopment Cons: The functionality would have been enhanced by replacing the net pouch with drawstring closure on the one wnd with a another of the more secure zippered pouch like the one on the other end. I would recommend this case.
customer_reviews.author: William F. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Bag for My Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have a mid-range amateur camera, but I'm shooting for semi-pro projects, and I need a case that can hold all of my crap, camera related and otherwise. It's a bit clunky, but I'd rather have it a bit too big than a bit too small, and it's padding is good protection. It also has a customizable cavity for whatever sized camera/video recorder you have (which is exactly what I needed).
customer_reviews.author: F. Day

customer_reviews.title: ACPro1200 Case is the Goldilocks Bag for me
customer_reviews.text: This case is perfect for me. It hold all my Lenses, Camera, and extras I need for an upcoming trip. It is very well padded. It is very well constructed. The shoulder strap detaches. The base has a rubber pad. It is easy to open and stays open as needed. Pouches are everywhere. Only had it for a week but I am very impressed. Would definitely Buy It Again.
customer_reviews.author: PGareis

customer_reviews.title: Fits Kemper, but not sure how it will hold up to heavy travel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my guitar rig. I have a Kemper profiling amp and a foot controller, as well as cables and in ears that all go in this. It all fits, but is fairly snug. I love the extra dividers that Velcro in place. I use them on top of the Kemper, between it and my foot controller. Works great. I’ve only had it maybe three months, using once a week, and the handles are starting to tear. So I’m not sure how well the build quality will hold up over time. But it’s good for light transportation for now. The whole rig is surprisingly heavy too.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Aulich

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera Bag
customer_reviews.text: I found sling bags to be a little small for my needs. So, i bought this case and i love it. It's very sturdy, easy to access, and plenty of room for my gear. I carry a a full sized Nikon body, two zooms, two primes, extension tubes, and filters. And, there is room for more. Don't hesitate.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvester_cat

customer_reviews.title: Great Case
customer_reviews.text: I got this case for my flash accessories and spare lights. Fits sooo much gear. I have all my Magmod gear, spare flashes, batteries, cold shoes, straps, lens cleaning gear, clamps, cards, water bottle, small tools, random things, and it is still just about half filled. Can fit more gear as I grow my business. The case is made up of quality materials and I am very confident it will last a very long time and keep my gear protected. Other cases have weak and uncomfortable straps but this Ape case strap is durable and comfortable for walking around with my gear.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Danny D

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bag
customer_reviews.text: We love this bag for our video gear as wedding videographers. We have a c100, a 6dmk2 and a Panasonic lumix lx100 in here with 35mm and 70-200 lenses, 2 rode videmic pros, 2 zoom h1s, a yongnuo y600 air and a 100 LED video light all in the main compartment. It has enough room for plenty of batteries and memory cards as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kristyn L

customer_reviews.title: glad I got the large instead of medium.
customer_reviews.text: Not as big as I had thought it would be, but definitely a good sized bag. It feels very sturdy, will hold my A77 with big beer can lens on "upper level" (body sits on raised area, which can be used for rarely used items) at one end, extending across the bag with what seems to be ALMOST enough room on the opposite end for another smaller DSLR body, no lens. (Can't check, I don't have second body) the bag is also tall enough to stand big beer can lens upright. Extra room for chargers, memory cards, filters, caps, etc. I still have room for more accessories. :)
customer_reviews.author: Tatooed Lady

customer_reviews.title: Good durable case, lots of customization.
customer_reviews.text: Nice durable case, good size for a carry on bag if you are taking your camera and lenses on a trip. The case just feels well made and offers a lot of storage and customization. I mainly got it because I needed a good carry on bag for my camera and a few lenses as well as my laptop and this case fit the bill perfectly. The only downside I must mention is that having that much stuff in one case can get very heavy and it will strain your shoulder if you are stuck in line at airport security like I was. Overall though it is an excellent case.
customer_reviews.author: Weston

customer_reviews.title: A place for everything
customer_reviews.text: This case is really well made, much better than expected for the price. The interior is completely customizable for whatever you put in it. Well build and well designed/laid out. It is amazing how much you can pack into such a small bag.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera Bag!
customer_reviews.text: I take a lot of real estate photos and couldn't seem to find the right gear bag until now. It's lightweight and has just enough room for my gear and accessories. I tried a back pack style and a messenger bag but the Ape Case is the best fit. I like that it keeps its shape when you aren't carrying it on your shoulder or set it down, its also well put together. The sides and bottom have extra padding for protection and the lid is very secure when closed, its zippered and has 3 clasps. Its also very comfortable to carry around. I would definitely recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: JpFlaKeys

customer_reviews.title: Great bag just not for me
customer_reviews.text: My biggest issue with this bag was simply the Velcro dividers. While the bag was plenty big (too big actually) to hold all my lenses, the dividers were more of a pain than they were convenient. But that’s just personal preference. The bag itself seemed to be very sturdy and fully capable of handling lots of travel. As someone who is only five foot tall, the bag was just too big for me to want to carry on a day to day basis.
customer_reviews.author: Eryn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome - Holds so much stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Love this case! I can fit way more than I really should try to put in there (weighs a ton now). It currently holds the following: Canon 6D with battery grip and Canon 24-70 F/2.8L IS attached (hood reversed) Canon 70-200 F/2.8L IS (with tripod color plus hood reversed) Canon 100mm F/2.8L IS (with tripod color plus hood reversed) Canon 430 EX MagMod flash modifier extra batteries extra memory cards 2 circular polarizers (82mm and 77mm) 2 ND filters (82mm and 77mm) cable release business card holder X-rite color checker passport Canon ST-E3-RT Speedlite Transmitter plus misc stuff (ie: box of mints, pen, fingernail clippers, etc)
customer_reviews.author: o2b4ft11

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: We used this to go across the country to film an interview for a documentary and it was great. It's a good size for a carryon and we were able to fit a professional video camera in it as well as a go pro.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: NICE Case!!!
customer_reviews.text: One of those purchased, thousands and thousands of choices on Amazon, but I decided to take a chance. I needed it and this seemed like it would be a good match. I am very happy with this purchase, nice layout, adjustable compartments (this is pretty normal in soft camera cases) really nice quality construction. Over the years I have come to understand the value of a good case, especially when dealing with expensive A/V equipment. It is a part of the cost and absolutely necessary. So I purchase a lot of cases and I will definitely consider an Ape case in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality case at a more than reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want a too large of a case, just big enough to hold my current photo gear and possibly another edition. The Ape Case Pro Medium fits the bill. Quality materials, flawless construction and you can't fault the day-glow yellow interior. If I'm looking to purchase another case in the future, Ape Case will be the brand of choice...
customer_reviews.author: Mark A.

customer_reviews.title: great inside dimensions
customer_reviews.text: I like it because of its inside dimensions. I can leave my 100-400 zoom lens attached to the camera body. The only thing I don't like is that it is so deep. I don't carry a laptop with me. I had to add some filling underneath the camera and lens to hold it up high enough I can reach in and get it when I see something.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best Camera Bag
customer_reviews.text: The best camera bag. Has lots of room for a Nikon D850 and a Nikon 70-200 2.8 lens. Lots of compartments for business cards, sd cards. Well made, sturdy and very well made straps.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Howell

customer_reviews.title: Great case for telephoto lens
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality! I specifically wanted a case that would carry my DSLR while attached to my Nikon 200-500 telephoto. This is a perfect fit, plus room for my laptop. Lots of pockets for accessories and can easily be reconfigured for different lenses.
customer_reviews.author: deb

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. I have done some "modification" like cut some straps off I never use. It's well made and I have a large DSLR and 4 lenses as well as many CF and SD cards and all sorts of accessories. I recommend it highly. Update: I got this bag in 2010. I have had it for 6 years. It has been great. I use a 7D and carry the camera with a lens attached with 3 other lenses. One lens is a 50mm F/1.8 so it fits under the camera. This bag is highly configurable. It carries all kinds of other stuff like cables, CF, or SD cards, filters, batteries, etc... I would buy this again. Great bag.
customer_reviews.author: nate42nd

customer_reviews.title: excellent for my video camera and it's accessories
customer_reviews.text: When doing videography gigs, I can easily find all my accessories quickly in their separate compartments. After a full year of travelling it is holding up with no signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fits alot
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for me. fits everything i want to bring with me,like a Nikon D850, Nikon D750,4 Nikon lens ,3 flashes, a mike,a I-pad mini, and a bunch more. Easy open top and easy to see whats in there and to take out.A little big but how else could everything fit so well.
customer_reviews.author: r&f

customer_reviews.title: Look No Further For A Fine Camera Bag!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I purchased the 1200 size case. It holds my camera body, zoom lenses (2), and a nifty fifty as well as my charger, 2 batteries, filters and cleaning supplies (With room to spare). The straps on the bottom of the case securely holds my mono pod with ease. The constructions is pretty heavy duty, The zippers work fine. The yellow interior is a huge plus especially when digging around the bottom of the bag. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT. It is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I absulutely love this case
customer_reviews.text: I absulutely love this case! I have several of another top brand cases and this is my first purchase from Ape Case. My D7200 and 300mm lens fit snuggly cradled inside with plenty of room for many more items. Thank you very much for putting out a quality product for me and other consumers. I am a Pro Photographer and have been published several times. I have thousands of dollars invested in my equipment and quality sturdy build and padding is essential to me. I will purchase from you in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Edson

customer_reviews.title: Best camera bag ever for long lenses
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy and well configured. It can fit a pro DSLR with a long lens and hood fully assembled and still have room for an extra lens and a small laptop. The main side zipper has plenty of room for gadgets and accessories. It is great for an airline carry-on for pro photographers. The top zipper is easy to open in a hurry so you don't miss a special shot.
customer_reviews.author: Robin F

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Value
customer_reviews.text: This case is well-built, providing excellent quality construction with some really nice organizing features. I didn't think that I would be able to do it, but this case fits three full size flashes, a wide angle camcorder lens, and a 70-300 zoom on the bottom level. I have an SLR and a camcorder on the top level. The pockets are great because they allow some easy organizing of battery chargers and flash controllers. Cables can fit in the mesh pocket on the case top. (See my images for photos of how I organized the layout.) I have owned many cases over my career, but this one offers the best value for its size and price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Sick bag, great prie, SPONSOR ME! @stefanvleming
customer_reviews.text: Its Perfect and such amazing price for quality! I mean COME ON! Ape Case, please sponsor me haha. I;m a DOP and needed this for travel shoots for my pentax 67 film camera. its good as a sling bag (even the biggest size I have the XL. I want one for every camera I own now! It has tons of customizability too, and separators etc. Highly recommend for anyone in the business or just a hobbyist, you cant beat the price for professional quality. .
customer_reviews.author: ZanGieF

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding camera bag.
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute best camera bad. I have the Large and have a Nikon P900, Canon 6D Mark ii, 24-70 lens and all cables, chargers,manuals and a couple filters. If you need a bag just pick your size.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C.

customer_reviews.title: This is a very useful & versatile bag
customer_reviews.text: This was very useful as a carry on bag for airline travel. I used it to carry multiple electronics & personal items. There is a large amount of usable space for a small bag.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Look no further...
customer_reviews.text: I have researched camera bags which were very expensive, but they do not hold a candle to this unbelievably affordable APE Case. It is very versatile, highly functional and extremely protective of all my included equipment from bumps and rain. I am glad that I took my time during my search. Almost purchased a $200 bag, but this is the one for me. I purchased the 1200 and it is really a big bag. The 1400 would have been too much for my needs. I recommend this bag to everyone; you will not be disappointed. If anything changes during the time I own this item, I will be sure to update my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Sporty - A Brooklyn Transplant

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I love this case. It's not quick access by any means, which is why I deducted one star. If that doesn't matter to you, then this case is freakin' tippy top notch.
customer_reviews.author: omgwtflol

customer_reviews.title: Easily holds big DSLR with battery/vertical grip and 18-200 or 18-300 zoom
customer_reviews.text: Easily holds big DSLR with battery/vertical grip and 18-200 or 18-300 zoom on the camera. Plenty of room for two or three extra lenses and batteries and charger and then some. Hard bottom in case and ample padding are great features. Detachable shoulder strap, nice. All zippered closures and then quick release style straps over them to secure the photo rig inside. Plenty of customizable pieces in the main compartment for however you need it to fit your stuff. Excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Permanently Amazed

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my choice
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs. Holds a lot of equipment, well padded, lighter than some of the other bags because of the shape and size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazn Artist

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy another if they had another color!
customer_reviews.text: Great case! For the price its worth every penny. Fits a body with 4 lenses, a flash, extra batteries, grey card, filters etc. Plenty of room and very organized. Strap was defective and broke after one month of use, however I contacted ApeCase and they sent me a BETTER more comfortable replacement strap and an exact replacement of the one I had so I could choose which I liked. Great customer service, great company! Im actually looking for another bag for more gear that I bought, I would buy this same bag again if it came in another color or design so I could differentiate between them in a rush.
customer_reviews.author: VanDylan888

customer_reviews.title: Ape Cases are great!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic case, like all the cases Ape Case makes. this is one of four Ape Cases I own. Each one of a slightly different design and size. I use them for: Photography. As a portable office with laptop, tablet, printer, scanner, label maker, chargers, and office supplies for my consulting businesses. For my bar tools, equipment, and supplies as a bar consultant/mixologist. And for my chef tools and equipment.
customer_reviews.author: JMForester

customer_reviews.title: Great Cases of all types!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic case, like all the cases Ape Case makes. this is one of four Ape Cases I own. Each one of a slightly different design and size. I use them for: Photography. As a portable office with laptop, tablet, printer, scanner, label maker, chargers, and office supplies for my consulting businesses. For my bar tools, equipment, and supplies as a bar consultant/mixologist. And for my chef tools and equipment.
customer_reviews.author: JMForester

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT. THERE IS NO BETTER BAG
customer_reviews.text: I can't fit 2 cameras, 3 zooms lenses, 3 LED panel lights, the light power adapters, 9 Sony batteries, an XLR cable, a 1/8th headphone cable, my Tascam dr-60, light stand clips, 8 AA batteries, all my SD cards, 6 LPE6 batteries, 2 lavalier mic cases and my wallet in this bag. It's the best bag ever. If I was homeless I would buy one and live in it.
customer_reviews.author: Miguelle Millo

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag is very well made. STRONG It is large enough for all video/still cameras and the additional(typical/common) Items stored. The sections are configurable. The tripod straps are very useful too. This is a fine bag for the serious camera enthusiast A working pro may need 2 of these bags The bright interior helps a lot to find dark colored items stored within. It is better than the camera bags sold by the camera mfg's and less money too ! Sometimes brand recognition is not worth it. It will give you many years of service.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice case, too small for full-frame + 2 lenses
customer_reviews.text: Product video says full-frame + 2 lenses fit. My D800E + 85mm f/1.8G fits in the body+lens spot in the case, barely. So far so good. Beyond that, the 4 remaining lens slots are too small for real lenses (maybe DX lenses would fit). Because of the size of the velcroed dividers, and the way the velcro is positioned around the sides of the case, it's not practical to turn those 4 tiny slots into 2 decent-sized slots (or at least, I couldn't figure it out). That said, it's a nice case, and a good value, which is why I gave it 4 stars, even though I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: approach

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: This is not exactly what I wanted in that it's larger than I thought it would be. Having said that, I need a bag to keep all my related camera items. I own a Canon 7D and the bag holds it and a couple zoom lenses comfortably. It is well padded from every angle and can be modified internally with movable walls so as to adjust to all your gear. As a storage bag it's perfect. For me it's somewhat large for moving around with - although even then it's ok since it doesn't scream, "expensive camera bag"! I'm well satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: DeBigBri

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: I already had a large Ape Case, but ended up with too much camera gear. I wanted a small case that would hold just my camera and a pair of lenses to take with my on shoots - the small Ape Case did the trick. I am able to stuff a D7100, 18-55 mm lens, 55-300 mm lens, plus my R strap and my SB-600 flash and some spare batteries into the case easily and take with me without being overly heavy. I do love the build quality on the Ape Case and the BRIGHT YELLOW interior!
customer_reviews.author: Donald Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this bag!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've probably gone through four or five photography bags over the last year as I upgraded cameras, including this bag's "big brother" the APE enormously large ACPRO2000 back pack bag. This one is by far my favorite. It has plenty of storage for big items like a Gary Fong Lightsphere, extra lens, external flash, etc., and a bunch of smaller pockets for SD cards, USB memory sticks, water bottle, filters, etc., yet it's easy to carry. The yellow interior also helps find things in dim light, and it appears to be extremely well built. Highly recommend this bag! I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Dumon PhotographyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Love it! So comfy + great storage.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is super comfy despite being sort of large in size. I hike with it and it works great. Holds my camera body + attached lens, secondary lens, as well a bunch of equipment. Love the pocket on the front for easily storing my phone, too. The fabric also feels nice & high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed by the fact that after looking at several bags ...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed by the fact that after looking at several bags and having in my head that it’s about 60 bucks I ordered the 1400 which is only 12 inches long. For a little more than a dollar more I should have gotten the 1600. I like the bag and the quality is very good! But I definitely need bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Slattery

customer_reviews.title: Nicely designed
customer_reviews.text: Nicely designed camera/laptop case which could hold a DSLR and three or four lenses plus a large (17+ inch) laptop. The top opening design makes access very easy. It would be nice to have a slightly smaller size case available for 15 inch laptops as this one gets heavy quickly and is a bit awkward to handle due to its length.
customer_reviews.author: Jim45056

customer_reviews.title: Roomy and functional
customer_reviews.text: From reading other reviews, I was worried that this might be too small. I was surprised to find that it is pleasantly bigger than I thought it would be. With a great walk-around lens like the Nikkor 18-200 VR and maybe a special purpose lens to boot, this thing holds all I need. I have a Nikon D50 with the aforementioned lens, an SB-800 flash, a 50mm 1.4, cleaning fluid and micro thread cloths, and other photo doo dads. This case is big enough to hold everything I need. I can't imagine lugging around anything larger than this. The materials and construction seem solid.
customer_reviews.author: A. D. Lum

customer_reviews.title: Holds a full size camera an two lenses. Ang accessories.
customer_reviews.text: High-quality case with a bright interior to help you see what is inside.
customer_reviews.author: Dfcu

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty with lots of pockets. Strong zippers. Easy to customize to your own setup.
customer_reviews.author: David Ludwig

customer_reviews.title: Fits Kemper Profiler and foot controller
customer_reviews.text: I have used this case to hold a Kemper Profiler and the foot controller and its cable. The bag has lots of inserts for you to configure the storage for a variety of electronic devices including equipment, cameras and more. The padding seems good and the zippers seem strong. I would recommend this to anyone looking for an equipment case. I do wish it was a little cheaper so one star off for that.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, holds a lot
customer_reviews.text: A large bag with lots of room for multiple lenses, flash, camera, and other accessories, this bag is well-made; just know that it is bulky and a bit heavy when loaded up. If you have lots of equipment that you need to have with you, it's a good bag to have. It will hold a lot. I recommend you purchase the Victorinox Comfort Fit Shoulder Strap to go along with it. Unfortunately, someone stole this bag full of stuff when I moved, so I can't speak to its durability.
customer_reviews.author: cjh

customer_reviews.title: Large Ape Case Shoulder Bag
customer_reviews.text: This camera bag is exactly what I needed. It holds everything that I normally need for the photography that I do. Several lenses, my DSLR, batteries, charger, etc. Seems to be very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent shoulder bar
customer_reviews.text: Fits my idea of the perfect "car" bag -- or to take you gear to a party or picnic Very well made, well thought out, but heavy on the shoulder when you load it up.
customer_reviews.author: M. OConnell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bag for serious photographers
customer_reviews.text: First of all, once I saw this beautiful then I realized I owned nothing but plastic bags before, guys this huge bag is awesome, it fits all my stuffs waiting for more, I had a77ii with 16-50mm attached, 35mm lens , 55-200mm Lens, external flash, gear of filters, 4 cables + 2 books with small accessories. It fits, and there is a room for 2 more lenses... Believe me it is well constructed and sturdy, elegant and yellow interior makes it unique, high recommend..
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed Ahmed El-Gazzar

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of storage!
customer_reviews.text: Storage everywhere! You can store you camera, video-recorder, and a good bonus a laptop! How awesome is that! I must warn you that if you plan on carrying a laptop for traveling, it may get heavy for periods of time. That's my only con. Everything else is great!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Great product regardless of price.
customer_reviews.text: Enormous capacity for any number of Camera(s) and accessories. High quality material, build, stitching and especially heavy duty zippers. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Dale V.

customer_reviews.title: and it works great for that
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to carry several large musical pedals and processors, and it works great for that. Lots of pockets cables power supplies and stuff too.
customer_reviews.author: Geetar

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING bag!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is a great purchase. I was a little worried at first I couldn't fit everything in, but I was oh so terribly wrong. I have -in this one back- 1 Canon 1Ds 1 Canon EOS Rebel 1 Canon EOS Rebel XT 1 28-135mm lens 1 18-55mm lens 1 50mm lens 1 2x macro lens adapter 1 extra camera lid w/ lens cap 4 battery chargers 1 tripod head 2 shoulder straps 1 hand grip 3 Camera manuals And I STILL have more room!! It's insane. There is only 1 downfall, it screams out "Important" so it also screams out "Steal me" ... make sure you keep an eye on it!
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this to hold my paranormal investigation gear. It's very sturdy and I like that I can customize the sections to fit my equipment. The yellow inner lining is also great, as we work in dark (or near dark) most of the time, so it only takes a little bit of light from my flashlight to help me find what I need. I compared a lot of bags online and this is the largest in this price range, and is even bigger than most other bags at this same price point.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I could not be more satisfied with this bag. The nylon exterior is mostly waterproof (kept my camera nice and dry in a rainstorm), the connections are all secure and the handle is nice and wide. It could stand to be a half inch wider on the inside, but that's only because I don't want to put my camera against the side of the bag and can only move that divider over a little. It comfortably holds (in the main compartment) 3 lenses, a flash unit, my backup PaS and an infrared PaS along with my shutter remote. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Trudell Jr

customer_reviews.title: I was really surpised how well built this case is.
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised at the quality of this case. It is well made, sturdy, and one of the best that I've seen on the market. It carries a Nikon D3200 with and extra 300mm lens, flash, filters, battery charger and various other accessories, and still has room for more. This case I found to be superior to cases that cost quite a bit more. I don't think that a professional photographer's equipment would all fit in this case, but for me it is great and has a lot of growing room.
customer_reviews.author: Antares

customer_reviews.title: Roomy!
customer_reviews.text: I do outdoor digital signage. I needed a bag that could carry my monitor, portable KB/M, cables, testers, antennas, tools, etc... Plenty of room in this bag! It's well padded. I've only had it for a month or so, but it stands up well to being on construction sites, etc... My only "complaint" is that the bungee cords on the front are held on by a junky plastic clip that doesn't lock well. The weight of a 25' extension cord was too much for this to hold. Aside from that one very minor flaw, great bag!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality camera/camcorder bag.
customer_reviews.text: Very well-biult. High quality camera and/or camcorder bag. The Large size is VERY LARGE
customer_reviews.author: Blkjakk

customer_reviews.title: Good case. DEFECTIVE STRAP
customer_reviews.text: Bought the bag May 24,2014. Good case. DEFECTIVE STRAP. Contacted APE Customer support was promised a replacement. Its been 6 months no replacement nor a word from Ape. Asked Amazon for help to get overdue replacement no luck. I would expect better support from Amazon than being passed on to merchant to settle the claim directly. Meantime, I am stuck with the defective strap. I am wishful thinking Amazon support will read this and do something about this issue. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Toy for big boy.

customer_reviews.title: Large bag, although size is a bit funny.
customer_reviews.text: Make no mistake, this is a rather bulky bag. It's heavily padded all over and protects the equipment from the elements. The only odd thing I have is just that I didn't expect the bag to be "fat". Since I'm used to the dinky Nikon starter bag, this bag definitely blows that one out of the water. It comfortably holds my Nikon D90 + Grip with 18-105 lens, Charger, Cleaning supplies, battery stuff, lens filters, Canon P&S, and still has space for 2 lens and another camera body.
customer_reviews.author: Toshi Yamioka

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: Holds all of my camera equipment perfectly. My wife is considering purchasing one as a carry on bag. Lots of nice compartments. Well padded. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L. Ray

customer_reviews.title: All my gear in one bag--amazing
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first, but nothing in its price range could match it. Now it holds my Pentax K30, K-01, both with lenses mounted (55-300mm, 40mm) plus 16-45, 10-17 fisheye, 18-55WR, Tamron 90mm macro, 50mm 1.4, 360 flash, batteries, chargers for both cameras, and assorted filters, flash memory and more. It is so good to have one bag with everything in it for a quick grab, and for taking in the car. I wouldn't want to carry it for long, but that is what a sling bag was made for. This bag even has straps for a tripod. Amazing value
customer_reviews.author: TJHeagney

customer_reviews.title: Finally, the right bag
customer_reviews.text: Believe it or not, I own 6 bags for the same kit. They all sounded like the best; the backpack, the one with pockets, etc. The problem was that I have three lenses for my dslr and the extra lens require a bit more space than the standard size bag. I didn't want to cart around a bag that weighed 50# but I needed a bag that held all the lenses and was lightweight. This is it. Don't go anywhere else. This bag is intelligently designed with spaces for everything, easy access to extra lenses, pockets for accessories, a comfortable strap. The bright color interior is an added bonus. This is the one.
customer_reviews.author: D. Elwood

customer_reviews.title: OMG!!  LOVE it!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg!! Now I can have my 2 cameras and video camera all in one bag along with all of their cords, batteries and other accesories.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella Leal-Pozo

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: The quality feels a little bit cheap, but the bag serves its purpose and has ample padding to protect your gear. It fits a T2i, 2 lenses (smaller - 50mm & fisheye) and 2 batteries perfectly. Probably too small for a pro photographer but perfect for my purposes and for light travelling. The bag has a bright yellow interior that I always get compliments on.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle D

customer_reviews.title: Great Case
customer_reviews.text: Great! Comes with tons of extra divider plus room inside to store them if your gear layout changes. I haven't traveled with it yet but I feel like it would stand up to a reasonable amount of abuse. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Great Case
customer_reviews.text: I have had this Camera Case now for 2 yrs. and by far this is the best case you can get. I went to the big stores and to the Camera Stores and no one had the size Camera Case that I needed. This case holds a 35mm Camera with lens on space for a 70-300mm lens, 50mm lens, wide angle lens, fish eye lens, wires , books, pens and I still have more room for a couple more Pieces. So if you need a Camera bag or just a bag, this bag will do nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy fuller

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag. I wanted a lens bag and a bag to have my other camera accessories like triggers and flashes. I was able to hold a nikon 70-200 2.8, tamron 15-30 2.8, tamron 70-300 and a tamron 24-70 2.8 on a Nikon D750. I also have 2 yongnu flashes in it and some batteries. There is still some space left!!. Excellent bag. Very solid build.
customer_reviews.author: Senthil Rajan

customer_reviews.title: Roomy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent “business” type camera storage system. Fits a TON and looks sharp. To have your laptop on hand at a shoot is extremely helpful if not a crucial tool for many!
customer_reviews.author: Tberg

customer_reviews.title: So far the best bag I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: So far the best bag I've ever owned. Two full size DSLR bodies, multiple lenses, flash and tons of other storage space. For the size, quality and price point I don't know if it can be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Josef Krotz

customer_reviews.title: Great Gear Bag!
customer_reviews.text: Bottom Line: I am very pleased with this bag. It holds my Canon Rebel T2i camera body, multiple lens, filter, external flash unit, and all the other necessary goodies you need to carry. The yellow interior lets you see everything, even if you're working in a near dark environment. The bag has plenty of small compartments for batteries, media cards, etc. If I ever fill all the compartments, it won't be the bag's fault. It just means I'm carrying too much stuff. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Louis C. Crouch Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bag!!
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this bag for my new Sony HXR-NX5U camcorder. I wanted a bag roomy enough to comfortably store not only my camcorder, without disassembling any of it but also to store my accessories as well. This bag is the perfect fit. It is high quality construction, very well padded to protect my investment. I'm completely satisfied and highly recommend this product to anyone loves quality at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Geno

customer_reviews.title: fit's even the biggest 17" toshiba laptop
customer_reviews.text: i've been using this bag for nearly 2 years now. it was one of the only ones i could find that would fit my 17" laptop (BARELY). it's travelled many hundreds of thousands of miles with me now, and hasn't let me down yet. well, except the netting tore within a few months, so that pocket is useless now...but the rest is good! :D
customer_reviews.author: 4theriders

customer_reviews.title: but I can easily fit all my staff in the bag
customer_reviews.text: It Is a little bigger than I expected, but I can easily fit all my staff in the bag. I like when my 70-200 canon lens always on and this bag allows me doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Olena

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with this bag. It's very well padded with a lot of pockets for those annoying but necessary camera accessories. I like the triple locks, making it more secure to travel without constantly checking your bag. The yellow re configurable interior makes packing and finding your stuff easier. I just wish there's an additional compartment at the back for a laptop. Other than that, this is an excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bag
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bag for my Panasonic HC-X1000 video camera. Holds the camera safely in the padded main section plus two large batteries, mic, cables, etc in various pockets.
customer_reviews.author: drumflight

customer_reviews.title: Great for pro and amateur alike.  Holds everything but tripod.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic bag. Very durable and lots of storage space, including numerous zippered pockets to carry any accessories you would need for any kind of camera. A well manufactured product and totally worth the price. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hammercook

customer_reviews.title: Nice case... but
customer_reviews.text: The photo shows a different interior than what I got. I was counting on laying my camera on top with the lens cradled in a cut out pouch. I didn't get that, so I can't carry the z6 with two other lenses and a flash.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good camera bag. It holds a lot of gear. The yellow color on the inside makes seeing your gear much easier than black or dark grey that you usually get with camera bags.It has rubber feet on the bottom so it doesn't sit directly on the ground when you sit it down. I'm very happy with the Ape Case.
customer_reviews.author: B. Rob

customer_reviews.title: Good for one camera
customer_reviews.text: I got this bag for my new Canon T2i camera and two lenses. It holds all of these things easily. It has multiple pockets and extra velcro space makers. I have an extra battery, battery charger, and a notebook easily stored with this bag. I think it's perfect for one camera but nothing more. Seems really great at protecting my camera as well, and I'm rather clumsy. It's well padded, very well put together, and doesn't seem cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Grape Ape
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. Great quality and a great companion to my camera and equipment. I am going to stick with the brand if it comes up again as a need.
customer_reviews.author: independant snob

customer_reviews.title: Great case for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great case for the money. Well made. Well padded. The inserts are many and of good quality. Very good shoulder strap. Currently my #1 bag for carrying a camera ON a gimbal, as well as a laptop and other support hardware, batteries, etc, all at once. Super pleased.
customer_reviews.author: DPStewart

customer_reviews.title: Protective but Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I picked this case because it was inexpensive and looked like the right size for what i needed. I really love it. It offers really good protection and i never have to worry about my camera and lenses in this. Fits my camera, two lenses, an extra battery, charger and my usb chord and still space for one more lens. I love its extra pockets for things like pens and notepads. i can actually just use this as my carry on on flights. It's a little uncomfortable though especially with the weight of the camera in it. I suggest buying a new strap if you can. And for how cheap you can get this? Not really a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Nikon d5000 and multiple lenses are comfortably and safely kept
customer_reviews.text: my wife loves her new camera bag. Nikon d5000 and multiple lenses are comfortably and safely kept. seems to be sturdy construction and very good amount of space in bag.
customer_reviews.author: mrgorgonslayer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case !!
customer_reviews.text: Large enough to carry DSLR Video rig set up . Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jon F. French

customer_reviews.title: Best Value for your Money...!!
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased other bags in this price range and nothing has been close to the quality of this bag. With some creative organization I can fit my D200, my D40x, 2 - SB600 flash units and up tp four lenses, not to mention all the extra pockets for your various bits and pieces. My only complaint, you might look unprepared because this bag isn't huge, but it still holds alot of equipment nicely. You won't regret this purchase. Top notch product - excellent price...!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Ape Case, Shoulder Bag for DSLR, Large, Pro Digital Photo/Video Camera Luggage case (ACPRO1600)
product_meta.description:
Size:X-LargeA shoulder bag that is truly designed for working professionals, and serious enthusiasts! This is Ape Case’s largest shoulder bag. The ACPRO1600 contains thick adjustable padding to configure your equipment to your needs for custom organization. This ensures your gear is concealed while you’re on the move. Artists love the signature Hi-Vis yellow interior. Smaller items such as memory cards, batteries, and other accessories are easier to see in low lighting. The easy-access features a slimmer profile, contoured to move easily with the body and help navigate busy airports, streets and crowded subways. Soft edges, briefcase styling, leather-like details at contact points, and a signature logo create a discreet aesthetic.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER



APE CASE PRO LUGGAGE CAMERA CASE ACPRO1600
The ACPRO1600 professional luggage camera case by Ape Case is the perfect companion for photographer aficionados. The signature Hi-Vis™ Yellow interior features 14 pockets and compartments that can be reconfigured multiple ways to hold a variety of cameras, lenses, and flashes. The case will hold SLR cameras, digital cameras, 35mm cameras, mini digital video cameras and a wide array of accessories. The zippers and heavily padded pockets secure the case closed and it has a special key ring holder in the front compartment and security handle for easy carrying. The luggage camera case comes with a deluxe-comfort shoulder strap.
feature_bullets: Compatible with SLR cameras, digital cameras, 35mm cameras, and digital video cameras
Contains 16 heavily padded pockets that discretely carry valuable equipment

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars621 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
